newsitem.title: CHINA: China to pour $1.08 trillion into state firms.
newsitem.headline: China to pour $1.08 trillion into state firms.

text.p: China is to invest about 9.0 trillion yuan ($1.08 trillion) in state-owned firms over the next five years, the China Enterprise News said in edition seen in Beijing on Friday.
Of that amount, about 5.1 trillion yuan would be sunk into seven major industrial sectors, the newspaper said.
More than 2.0 trillion yuan would be spent on energy projects during the period, accounting for about 25 percent of investment in the state sector, it said.

About 1.135 trillion yuan would be poured into the transportation and shipping sectors, 460 billion yuan into the petrochemical industry, 500-600 billion yuan into the machinery industry and 280 billion yuan into the automobile sector, the newspaper said.
Investment in primary industry would rise to 3.1 percent of total state sector funding or 280 billion yuan, of which 200 billion yuan would go to water conservancy and irrigation projects, it said.
Funds for the electronics industry would rise to 5.4 percent of state-sector investment from an average of 2.2 percent in the past five years, it said but gave no further details.
